trans-unit.source: If set to true, enables row-level locking. When you disable row-level locking, you use table-level locking.

seg-source.mrk: If set to true, enables row-level locking.
When you disable row-level locking, you use table-level locking.

target.mrk: If set to true, enables row-level locking.
When you disable row-level locking, you use table-level locking.

trans-unit.source: Row-level locking uses more system resources but allows greater concurrency, which works better in multi-user systems. Table-level locking works best with single-user applications or read-only applications.

seg-source.mrk: Row-level locking uses more system resources but allows greater concurrency, which works better in multi-user systems.
Table-level locking works best with single-user applications or read-only applications.

target.mrk: Row-level locking uses more system resources but allows greater concurrency, which works better in multi-user systems.
Table-level locking works best with single-user applications or read-only applications.

trans-unit.source: If you use row-level locking (the default), the system decides whether to use table-level locking or row-level locking for each table in each DML statement. In certain situations, the system might choose to escalate the locking scheme from row-level locking to table-level locking to improve performance.

seg-source.mrk: If you use row-level locking (the default), the system decides whether to use table-level locking or row-level locking for each table in each DML statement.
In certain situations, the system might choose to escalate the locking scheme from row-level locking to table-level locking to improve performance.

target.mrk: If you use row-level locking (the default), the system decides whether to use table-level locking or row-level locking for each table in each DML statement.
In certain situations, the system might choose to escalate the locking scheme from row-level locking to table-level locking to improve performance.

trans-unit.source: For more information about locking, see "Locking and performance" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>, and "Locking, concurrency, and isolation" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

seg-source.mrk: For more information about locking, see "Locking and performance" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>, and "Locking, concurrency, and isolation" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

target.mrk: For more information about locking, see "Locking and performance" in <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph>, and "Locking, concurrency, and isolation" in the <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph>.

trans-unit.source: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.

seg-source.mrk: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.

target.mrk: This property is static; if you change it while <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> is running, the change does not take effect until you reboot.
